description: The patient encounter diagnosis table contains one record for each diagnosis associated with each encounter level of service. This table will contain all diagnoses specified on the Order Summary screen.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number of the diagnosis within the encounter. This is the second column in the primary key and uniquely identifies this diagnosis on the encounter.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The contact date of the encounter associated with this diagnosis. Note: There may be multiple encounters on the same calendar date.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.

columns.name: DX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the diagnosis record associated with the patient encounter. Note: This is NOT the ICD9 diagnosis code. It is an internal identifier that is typically not visible to a user.

columns.name: ANNOTATION
columns.description: The annotation (description) text entered for this diagnosis by the clinical system user. This field is NULL if no annotation was entered during the encounter.  Order entry in clinical system limits this field to 160 characters.

columns.name: DX_QUALIFIER_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value for the diagnosis qualifier. This field is null if no qualifier was entered.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: PRIMARY_DX_YN
columns.description: This is a one character field that indicates whether this diagnosis was the primary diagnosis for the encounter. If the diagnosis was the primary this field will have a value of 'Y' otherwise it will have a value of 'N'.

columns.name: COMMENTS
columns.description: Any text comment associated with the encounter diagnosis. This field is NULL if no comment was provided.

columns.name: DX_CHRONIC_YN
columns.description:
Stores the chronic flag for a diagnosis.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: DX_UNIQUE
columns.description: Unique identifier given when a diagnosis is added to the encounter diagnosis list.

columns.name: DX_ED_YN
columns.description:
Definitively identifies an encounter diagnosis (I EDG 18400) as being an ED clinical impression. This is important to differentiate ED diagnoses from diagnoses filed to the same item as in the IP setting.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: DX_CHRONIC_YN

columns.name: DX_LINK_PROB_ID
columns.description: Stores the problem ID of the linked problem.
